abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Reform of Secondary Education
            Project, entails the construction of a high school at
            Riversdale, Saint Catherine, in Jamaica, where illegal
            households occupy the prospective construction site. Based
            on survey results, the total number of households is six, of
            which dwellings consist of board structures, currently in a
            state of disrepair, with no proper utilities in place.
            Discussions held with the settlers indicated their
            willingness to relocate, for which a location was
            identified. However, settlers preferred to choose their own
            site, consequently different areas in Riversdale have been
            already selected, in some cases, even construction has
            started. As per resettlement guidelines, and procedures,
            affected settlers will be provided with assistance in terms
            of building materials. The Estate Management Division of the
            National Land Agency will be responsible for monitoring the
            adequacy of the resettlement process, while the Ministry of
            Education will make reasonable efforts to follow up, and
            determine whether the process fairly restored the
            livelihoods of affected people, or, as needed, shall ensure
            the provision of further assistance through the relevant
            Government institution.
